str2: And yet, although, though. From kai and toi; and yet, i.e. Nevertheless.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: Her own, his own, their own, themselves, they. Contracted for heautou; self.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To work that which is good, perform good deeds. From agathos and ergon; to work good.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To offer, give; I put, place. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to give.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Rain. From a primary huo; rain, especially a shower.
From heaven, from the sky. From ouranos and the enclitic of source; from the sky.
Fruitful. From karpos and phero; fruitbearing.
Fitting season, season, opportunity, occasion, time. Of uncertain affinity; an occasion, i.e. Set or proper time.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To fill up, satisfy. Or empletho em-play'-tho; from en and the base of pleistos;to fill in, i.e. to satisfy.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.
Food, nourishment, maintenance. From trepho; nourishment; by implication, rations.
Joy, gladness, rejoicing. From the same as euphraino; joyfulness.
